content.$t:
title: Surrogate, nerrative: “Surrogate” merges military and sculptural aesthetics; it is a metaphor for the learning process, and the growth one gains by overcoming obstacles.

This work is available for sale through the Napa ARTwalk program - the current value estimated by the artist is $3,000. Ten percent of all sales during the exhibition supports the Napa ARTwalk. If you are interested in more information about purchasing a sculpture on display, please call the City of Napa’s Economic Development Division at 707-257-9502., make: Lumber, concrete, and grass sod 39" x 60" 66" - 2010, artist: Michael Hall, hometown: Oakland CA, email: michael@michaelhallpaintings.com, website: www.michaelhallpaintings.com

content.$t:
title: Tree of Life, nerrative: Tree of Life Angelina and Joel are a husband and wife team artist team. Featuring colorful, abstracted shapes, their sculpture plays with themes of evolution. After rendering the images each sculpture is reproduced directly on sheet metal, cut-out and physically taken into three dimension by Heidel who realized the work by welding two-dimensional shapes into three dimensional images, assisted by Marino. The sculpture is meant to represent the tree of life as told in numerous creation stories. As the viewer walks around the sculpture, they will notice the transition of colors from cool purples and blues to bright pinks and oranges, meant to signify a transition from day to night.

This work is available for sale through the Napa ARTwalk program - the current value estimated by the artist is $4,200. Ten percent of all sales during the exhibition supports the Napa ARTwalk. If you are interested in more information about purchasing a sculpture on display, please call the City of Napa’s Economic Development Division at 707-257-9502., make: Direct metal sculpture, paint 77" x 42" x 34" - 2011, artist: Angelina Marino-Heidel and Joel Marino-Heidel, hometown: Portland, OR, email: FALSE, website: www.artspa.us

gsx$nerrative.$t:

After rendering the images each sculpture is reproduced directly on sheet metal, cut-out and physically taken into three dimension by Heidel who realized the work by welding two-dimensional shapes into three dimensional images, assisted by Marino. The sculpture is meant to represent the tree of life as told in numerous creation stories. As the viewer walks around the sculpture, they will notice the transition of colors from cool purples and blues to bright pinks and oranges, meant to signify a transition from day to night.

content.$t:
title: Riding the Tide in, nerrative: Riding the Tide In features a rendered dorsal fin made from reclaimed cedar. It alludes to biological adaptation—imagine sea animals on land!— a possibility in our changing world.

This work is available for sale through the Napa ARTwalk program - the current value estimated by the artist is $6,000. Ten percent of all sales during the exhibition supports the Napa ARTwalk. If you are interested in more information about purchasing a sculpture on display, please call the City of Napa’s Economic Development Division at 707-257-9502., make: Reclaimed Cedar 84" x 72" x 19" - 2013, artist: David Turner, hometown: Gazelle, CA, email: david@rockfarmstudio.com, website: www.rockfarmstudio.com

content.$t:
title: Pas de Deux, nerrative: Pas de Deux captures two dancers lifted into a perfect moment. The rhythm of the dance has power and beauty, requiring great strength and control as two people strive to create something greater than each alone. "Pas de Deux" shows an instant of time in which the two dancers are in a maximum stage of exertion and extension, only to be followed by more movement, which flows from moment to moment in a constant metamorphosis for the viewer and performers alike.

This work is available for sale through the Napa ARTwalk program - the current value estimated by the artist is $22,000. Ten percent of all sales during the exhibition supports the Napa ARTwalk. If you are interested in more information about purchasing a sculpture on display, please call the City of Napa’s Economic Development Division at 707-257-9502., make: Fabricated steel structure 9' x 6' x 6' - 2010, artist: Jack Sewell, hometown: Eureka, CA, email: FALSE, website: www.jacksewell.com

gsx$nerrative.$t:

content.$t:
title: Thirty, nerrative: Thirty is abstract in nature and reflects Nomura's sensibilities of the Modern Art movement, his Japanese-American heritage, and a Japanese cultural background. Educated as a botanist and trained as a carpenter, his visual inspirations are drawn from both endeavors. A legacy of wood carvers, as well the minimal, unadorned Quaker meeting houses where he sometimes worshiped, leave imprints of simplicity and unity in his work.

This work is available for sale through the Napa ARTwalk program - the current value estimated by the artist is $10,000. Ten percent of all sales during the exhibition supports the Napa ARTwalk. If you are interested in more information about purchasing a sculpture on display, please call the City of Napa’s Economic Development Division at 707-257-9502., make: Cast and fabricated bronze 45" x 26" x 20" - 2012, artist: Stephen Nomura, hometown: Berkeley, CA, email: FALSE, website: www.stephenknomura.com

gsx$nerrative.$t:

This work is available for sale through the Napa ARTwalk program - the current value estimated by the artist is $10,000. Ten percent of all sales during the exhibition supports the Napa ARTwalk. content.$t:
title: Cindunia!, nerrative: Cindunia! Literally translated, cin dunia means “eat the world.” In West Africa, it is an invitation to “Live Life to the Fullest!” Through Cindunia, the viewer is encourged to grow, learn, imagine, explore, change, and love.

This work is available for sale through the Napa ARTwalk program - the current value estimated by the artist is $18,500. Ten percent of all sales during the exhibition supports the Napa ARTwalk. If you are interested in more information about purchasing a sculpture on display, please call the City of Napa’s Economic Development Division at 707-257-9502., make: Fabricated mild steel with patina 132" x 126" x 126" - 2012, artist: Kenneth Hall, hometown: Lacey, WA, email: ken@solsticestudio.com, website: www.solsticestudio.com
